articles.title: These Bald Eagles fly the wrong way every year and stun scientists
articles.description: Scientists tracking young Arizona Bald Eagles found that many migrate north during summer and fall, bucking the traditional southbound pattern of most birds. articles.description: A new economic modeling tool is helping Maine kelp farmers identify cost-saving strategies with remarkable precision. articles.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
articles.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.
